page.title: 15 THE RIVER DEE.
page.content: FLOWING THROUGH OUR VILLAGE IS THE {RIVER DEE.}IT IS THE THIRD LONGEST RIVER IN WALES.THE FIRST AND SECOND BEING{THE SEVERN}AND{THE WYE}.THE DEE STARTS AT BALD LAKE AND FLOWS EASTWARDS THROUGH LLANGOLLEN,INTO CHESHIRE AND ON THROUGH CHESTER.ONCE IN CHESTER IT TURNS ABRUPTLY NORTH AND FLOWS IN THE DIRECTION OF LIVERPOOL WHERE IT BECOMES AN ESTUARY AND FLOWS PAST THE LEFT-HAND SIDE OF{THE WIRRAL AND IT THEN FLOWS TO{THE IRISH SEA}. ONE OF THE MANY VILLAGES IT PASSES THROUGH IS{HOLT}.THE RIVER DEE HAS BECOME VERY INDUSTRIALISED.THIS IS BECAUSE OF THE POINT OF AYR COLLIERY AND THE COAL HAVING TO BE TRANSPORTED. BECAUSE THERE WERE NOT THE HEAVY GOODS LORRIES THAT THERE ARE NOW,BARGES HAD TO BE USED.THESE ARE STILL USED TODAY IN SOME PLACES BUT THEY HAVE BEEN SLOWLY PHASED OUT AS THE LORRIES
